page.title: 06SMITH FARM
page.content: {The Smith Farm This is a typical farm in this part of Gwent. Mr. and Mrs. Smith have lived on this farm at the top of Penyrhoel for fifteen years. The farm was established in 18O6. It is a thirty-one acre stock rearing farm. It is family run, two sons helping with the work. Mr. Smith's day begins at 5.45a.m., when he gets up and has breakfast. His first job at 6.3Oa.m. is to move the electric fence to allow the cattle to graze. He has seventeen cows, eight of them are rearing calves. He has two pedigree Hereford bulls and one four day old Hereford bull calf. Each of the eight feeding cows have one or two calves. Mr. Smith then feeds the pigs, collect the eggs and feed all the other animals.
